com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface OMPGetExternalCostForOptionsUE


  • public interface OMPGetExternalCostForOptionsUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getExternalCostForOptions(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The OMPGetExternalCostForOptionsUE user exit is called to filter out the carrier services, override per unit costs for product choices or reject the product choice.

    • Method Detail

      • getExternalCostForOptions

        org.w3c.dom.Document getExternalCostForOptions(YFSEnvironment env,
                                               org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The OMPGetExternalCostForOptionsUE user exit is called to filter out the carrier services, override per unit costs for product choices or reject the product choice.

        Input XML contains all possible assignments that were generated for promise lines. The UE is called once per sourcing rule sequence. The same assignments could be passed due to multiple sourcing rule details. It is recommended to use caching in UE implementation to avoid repetitive calculations.
        NOTE: This user exit is called by promising APIs.
        NOTE: Assignments with carrier services are generated if DetermineCarrierService="Y" is passed in the findInventory API.
        NOTE: The user exit is invoked before entering the solver if the rule ENABLE_SHADOW_SOLVER is not enabled for the enterprise and UE template isn't extended to include the SuggestedOption element.
        NOTE: If the rule ENABLE_SHADOW_SOLVER is enabled for the enterprise and the UE template is extended to have the SuggestedOption element, the UE input xml will include the SuggestedOption element. With this, there will be a significant impact to the performance of the api as there will be an additional call to the solver each time the UE output overrides the choices.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: The user exit is called unconditionally.

        Post-conditions: The output should be an XML.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the findInventory API / other promising APIs.
        inXML - contains all possible assignments that were generated. For more information, see the associated input files.


        Returns:
        An XML document. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
